titleStmt.title: Part of the 7th 08. Epistle of ye 1st 08. Book
of Horace imitated, & address'd

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Ed. 2nd 08.
Harley, the Nation's great Support,
Returning home one Day from Court
(His mind with publick cares possesst,
All Europe's Business in his Brest.)
Observ'd a Parson near Whitehall,
Cheap'ning old Authors on a Stall,
The Priest was pretty well in Case,
And Shew'd Some Humouṛ in his Face;
Look'd with an easye, careless mien,
A perfect Stranger to ye Spleen;
Of Size, that might a Pulpitt fill,
But more inclining to Sit still.My Lord, who (if a Man may Say't)
Loves mischief better than his meat,
Was now dispos'd to crack a Iest;
And bid friend Lewis go in quest
(This Lewis is a Cunning Shaver,
And very much in Harley's Favouṛ)
In quest who might this Parson be,
What was his name, of what degree;
If possible, to learn his Story,
And whether he were Whig or Tory?Lewis his Patron's humour knows,
Away upon his Errand goes,
And quickly did ye matter Sift,
Found out that this was Dṛ S────t:
A Clergyman of Speciall Note,
For shunning those of his own Coat;
Which made his Brethren of ye Gown
Take Care betimes to run him down:
No Libertine, nor overnice,
Addicted to no Sort of vice;
Went where he pleas'd, Said what he thought,
Not rich, but ow'd no Man a Groat;
In State-Opinions A-la-mode,
He hated Wh────n like a Toad;
Had giv'n ye Faction many a Wound,
And libell'd all ye Iunta round;
Kept Company with Men of Witt,
Who often father'd what he writt;
His Works were hawk'd in every street,
But Seldom rose above a Sheet:
Of late indeed ye Paper-Stamp
Did very much his Genius cramp.
And Since he cou'd not Spend his fire,
He now intended to retire.Said Harley, I desire to know
From his own mouth, if this be So?
Step to ye Dṛ straight and Say,
I'd have him dine with me to day.
S────t seem'd to wonder what he meant,
Nor wou'd believe My Lord had Sent;
So never offer'd once to stirr,
But coldly Said, Your Servant, Sir.
Does he refuse me? Harley cry'd:
He does with Insolence & Pride.
Some few days after Harley 'Spies
The Doctoṛ fasten'd by ye Eyes,
At Charing-Cross, among ye Rout,
Where painted Monsters are hung out.
He pull'd ye String, & Stopt his Coach,
Beckning ye Doctoṛ to approach.S────t who cou'd neither fly nor hide,
Came Sneaking to ye Chariot Side,
And offer'd many a lame Excuse;
He never meant ye least abuse────
“My Lord────the honouṛ you design'd────
“Extremely proud────but I had din'd────
“I'm Sure I never Shou'd neglect────
“No man alive has more Respect────
Well, I Shall think of this no more,
If you'll be sure to come at Four.The Doctoṛ now obeys ye Summons,
Likes both his Company & Commons;
Displays his Talent, Sits till Ten,
Next day invited, comes agen.
Soon grows Domestick, seldom fails
Either at Morning or at Meals,
Came early, & departed late:
In Short, ye Gudgeon took ye Bait.My Lord, towou'd carry on ye Iest,
And down to Windsor takes his Guest;
S────t much admires ye Place & Air,
And longs to be a Canon there;
In Summer, round ye Park to ride,
In Winter────never to reside.
A Canon! that's a Place too mean:
No, Doctor, you Shall be a Dean;
Two dozen Canons round youṛ Stall,
And you ye Tyrant o're them all:
You need but cross ye Irish Seas
To live with Plenty, Power & Ease.Poor S────t departs, & what is worse,
With borrow'd money in his Purse;
Travells at least a hundred Leagues
And Suffers numberless Fatigues.Suppose him now a Dean compleat,
Devoutly lolling in his Seat;
The Silver Virge with decent Pride,
Stuck underneath his Cushion-Side:
Suppose him gone thro' all Vexations,
Patents, Installments, Abjurations,
First-Fruits, & Tenths, & Chapter-Treats,
Dues, Payments, Fees, Demands & Cheats,
(The wicked Laity's contriving,
To hinder Clergy-men from thriving)
Now all ye Doctor's Money's Spent,
His Tenants wrong him in his rent;
The Farmer's Spitefully combin'd,
Force him to take his Tythes in kind,
And 1The Dean's Agent a French-man. Parvisol discounts Arrears,
By Bills for Taxes & Repairs.Poor S────t with all his Losses vext
Not knowing where to turn him next;
Above a Thousand Pounds in Debt,
Takes horse, & in a mighty Frett
Rides day & night at Such a Rate,
He Soon arrives at Harley's Gate;
But was so dirty, pale, & thin,
Old Read wou'd hardly let him in.Said Harley, Wellcome, Reverend Dean!
What makes your Worship look So lean?
Why sure you won't appear in town,
In that old Wigg, & rusty Gown?
I doubt your heart is Set on Pelf
So much, that you neglect your Self.
What! I suppose now Stocks are high,
You've Some good Purchase in your Eye;
Or is your money out at use?────Truce, good my Lord, I beg a Truce!
The Doctor in a Passion cry'd;
Your raillery is misapply'd:
I have Experience dearly bought,
You know, I am not worth a Groat:
But you're resolv'd to have your Iest,
And 'twas a Folly to contest:
Then Since you now have done your worst
Pray leave me, where you found me first.170-308F
